subject: Can a comic make it on Capitol Hill?
body:
Tonight On CNN Email







April 11, 2007








 





9 p.m. ET


 

LARRY KING LIVE: Al Franken


Can a comedian make it in politics? Al Franken gives his first prime-time interview since entering a Senate race in Minnesota. He tells Larry King why he's running -- and what he thinks about Don Imus. Watch tonight, 9 p.m. ET, on CNN!









 
 





 




6:00 a.m. ET


 

American Morning


The inside scoop on home buying and selling. From mortgage rates to closing costs, get the most news in the morning about your American home.











 





6:00 p.m. ET


 

Lou Dobbs Tonight


We'll explore why workers are demanding special treatment form their employers based on their religious beliefs.







7:00 p.m. ET


 

The Situation Room


Sen. Chris Dodd announced his presidential run on the Don Imus show. Now what does he have to say?  He'll tell us in "The Situation Room."







8:00 p.m. ET


 

Paula Zahn NOW: Out in the Open


Is the American dream now an American nightmare? Immigrants are one of the hardest hit in the mortgage meltdown. You'll be amazed to find out why. "Debtor Nation" series continues.







9:00 p.m. ET


 

Larry King Live


Can a comedian make it in politics? Al Franken gives his first prime-time interview since entering a Senate race in Minnesota. He tells Larry King why he's running.







10:00 p.m. ET


 

Anderson Cooper 360


Don Imus has a track record when it comes to uttering racial slurs.  Should his sponsors and even his guests be held accountable too?  Anderson Cooper is keeping them honest.
